intro: Elaterium tamnoides, commonly known as the Indian sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to the Himalayan regions and thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in dry conditions. Elaterium tamnoides is often found in alpine and subalpine zones, where it contributes to the biodiversity of high-altitude ecosystems.
